Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: pete j
Reviews.Content: The room, bathroom towels were clean, good breakfast and staff were helpful and friendly. It was well worth the price. I will use them again

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: PatBenatar
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a romantic getaway or a palacial swanky pad then this isnt for you. However, if you need somewhere easy to get to, clean, with your own bathroom and breakfast included then this is it. I had a delightful little time, I was just in the area for the night and this was perfect for getting my head down. The entrance to the hotel isnt the nicest but who cares. The price is brilliant. I have paid much much more money and stayed in much much worse places than this while in London. The staff were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was even more than i expected, there is the usual choice of cereals, but then you can sort of have a fry up made to order (without the meat). I had eggs on toast, a bowl of cereal, some OJ and some lovely fresh coffee. Perfect. No hassle check in, rooms clean (although one of the pillows smelled of sweat - but theres not much you can do about that! I just changed the pillows around. Small but perfectly formed en-suite with a good power shower). If I had to pick holes, the bedside lamps didnt have bulbs in them and there was no spoon for my tea! Did I really care about this? No. The bus stops are a minutes walk away and easy to find once off the underground. I would definitely stay here again. Absolute value for money in a really accessible part of town.

Reviews.Title: “One step up from a hostel.... Just....”
Reviews.Author: PhileasPhil
Reviews.Content: The place itself was clean ..the staff were nice.. But my room had serious maintenance problems.. Hmm where to start.. There was no plug in the hand basin..(although they did later supply one but when I pulled the lever to empty the basin I found it wasnt attached so had to dig the plug out with my fingernails.. Lovely..) the toilet seat was not properly attached.. The shower was impossible to get a reasonable temperature..so I had a cold one.. The telly wasnt tuned in.. The wastebin didnt work..and the bedside light had no bulb..or string to switch it on..oh and the thumping music from somewhere near outside didnt help.. Nice people though..

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa186525
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel as a group of four girls who were looking for cheap accomodation in this area. We were a bit unsure of what to expect given reviews and pictures but overall the hotel was clean and organised. The rooms are basic but well laid out and clean, the bathroom albeit small was fine for the 4 of us. It was a bonus that it was group room so we all had our own beds (not usually the case with triple or quad rooms). We were more than happy with the breakfast of toast and cereal, it was quite nice that the hotel is small enough that its not too busy at breakfast time etc. The staff were friendly and laid back, for the budget price we paid it was really good value for money and we would stay here again. As mentioned they will charge you for using cards to pay but we just went and withdrew cash which was no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant budget room”
Reviews.Author: Emily-Jo1968
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly, room clean, comfortable and was very nice to have been provided with two pillows each and you have a choice of having a continental breakfast for Â£4 a person which consists of cereals, juices, tea or coffee, toast, beans, eggs which I didnt have but thought it was very good value. Tip....pay by cash as they charge 3.5% for using a debit or a credit card. Walls are thin and the people in the room next to us were rather noisy but at the end of the day if you want 5 star luxury then you have to pay for it. Was nice to have tea/coffee facilities in room although we only had 2 tea bags but staff are more than happy to provide more. Shower door did not close properly so water leaked over the bathroom floor. No lift at this hotel so have to climb stairs and are no phones in the room to call down to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RB_02
Reviews.Content: Clean Room. Friendly and helpful staff. Overall value for Money. Would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: atticusaunt
Reviews.Content: The 'hotel' bears no resemlence to the website and beware of paying upfront as you may not want to stay when you get there. Bedding unclean, bathrooms unclean, cup and glass in room unclean, not very secure, previously used soap bars in the bathroom. strange set up altogether. Dont opt in for the breakfast either as you wont want to have it when you see the place. staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Malm_Rba
Reviews.Content: Good comfort, kind staff, very decent! Lots of good things to say. But both walls and pillows are thin, and cleaning equipment was visible around the hotel, but the place was good overall, especially considering the price! Good!!

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting place I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: Peasb0dy
Reviews.Content: Do NOT be fooled by a good website or any good reviews. I got put in a room that wreaked of ammonia. When the room got changed the member of staff came on to me. Made me feel very uncomfortable and vulnerable. Knocked on my door too much! The room above me had a prostitute in it. At 2am the bathroom roof started leaking, no, pouring water all over the floor. Hairs in bed, and in bathroom. Bed falling apart. Extensive mould on ceiling

Reviews.Title: “Over priced but clean”
Reviews.Author: Luscious x
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and basic but not value for money. The rooms was okay, bathroom facilities worked. However, the extra surcharge for paying by debit card (Â£5.00) is a disgraceful way of the hotel earning a bit of extra money. The receptionist was friendly and helpful. Can't say fairer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: There is no such thing as a free lunch in this world one gets what one pays for. In my opinion if one just needs a bed in London great value for money. Staff were friendly and charming. The big bonus was a secure free car space. The room was clean and adequate. Location great and fantastic bus service outside the hotel on Mare Street. I am back down to London in a couple of weeks and have a meeting near Liverpool Street - I have booked again. What more does one need to say. For the money breakfast was fine - coffee, orange juice, cereal and banana and a couple of eggs on toast. Also manned 24 hours. Think the poor reviews are just expecting too much for the small amount of money charged!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Danny5111
Reviews.Content: Not a problem for the price paid,it is basic,clean and friendly and most of all it does its job...

Reviews.Title: “Good location/room/value/facilities”
Reviews.Author: KerryClear
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel regular whenever Judy's Vintage Fair is at York Hall in Bethnal Green, try to stay here every time as the parking is easy, free, and seems safe as it is off the road and by the doors to the hotel where there is always someone on the reception. The rooms are comfy, the staff are very friendly (been offered a choice between rooms before) the rooms are spacious and comfortable with tea/coffee facilities and en suite bathroom. Decorated modern, the marble entrance is pretty awesome. 10 minute walk to the tube too so all in all, this is a good choice whatever your reason for travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LTTravel0102
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here.Shower is broken.Faucets attachments are loose. The first room we had ,the sink was blocked.plumbing looks like DIY to me since all the faucets are loosely put together ! The second room 's shower attachment was broken ! Again loose faucets ! Room is small and bathroom is really small.I do not mind the smallness of the place,but I did mind the below average workings of the plumbing..and broken shower ! Cheaper here compared to other hotels but I rather pay a bit more and stay somewhere else where all the plumbing works. It is a long walk to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: zozie84
Reviews.Content: After getting lost and not being able to find the hotel, I phoned up reception and they were very good in guiding me by phone to reach them! Was a little worried by the exterior passage, but the actual hotel was lovely, clean and smart! very friendly staff, happy and chatty :o) loved the 24hr access. A very convinient local, 10min max walk to Bethnal Green Tube Station. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and felt very welcomed! I checked out on the day the Hackney Riots began and I just hope that all is safe and well at this hotel! Thank you very much and see you soon hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Prais41
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Clean room, great value. Check-in was very friendly and efficient, room was as expected. Breakfast was provided, the facility of Tea and coffee was also provided in the room. Staff was very help full and gave a very warm welcoming. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly and helpful staff and perfect for travelling into the City.”
Reviews.Author: Robnes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for working locally or in the City as there is a surface rail link (London Fields) within a few hundred yards which takes you direct to Liverpool St Station in about 10 minutes. There are bus links within 100 yards into the city or to other parts of Hackney Borough. There is plenty of night life within a few hundred yards with excellent restaurants and bars. I stay at the City Inn a few times a month for work and am so pleased with it that I have continued to use the hotel for over a year and will continue to stay there while I am working in London.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaPapa
Reviews.Content: The hotel stuff is really friendly and helpfull. I enjoyed my staying there! highly recommended! It was excellent value for money and ideally situated for transport to the city centre.Tea/coffee making facilities provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a convenient location - good for those on a limited budget”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaCanterbury
Reviews.Content: We spent a comfortable night here. Our room was small but clean and quiet. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was cereal, juice, eggs and beans. There is a good range of cafes and restaurants nearby and the hotel is adjacent to bus stops. Not the Ritz but good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended - grim”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireKillieboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel up an alley through derelict building. Overlooks 24 hour gagrage. Rooms have paper thin walls . Ridiculous Â£5 debit card charge. One of worst hotels I have stayed in. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “A fair price for a basic room”
Reviews.Author: saddlersfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night October 2010 as I was attending my brother's wedding. I booked in advance and then read the reviews - filled me full of dread but the good reviews convinced me not to cancel! On arriving, the signage is on a derelict building but access is through a narrow arch. Arriving early I was able to take advantage of the free parking - always a bonus in London! I was advised where to park and check in was quick and easy. The marble staircase is very striking. We had two rooms on the third floor - a double and a triple room. Both rooms were clean and tidy, although my children did pass comment after we left that there was what appeared to be a rat or mouse trap in their room! There was no sign of any vermin though. The rooms were clean and tidy, not huge but big enough. The bathrooms were adequate. Provided was enough towels for everyone and some toiletries (soap and shower gel). Our room overlooked the back so was quiet (apart from the occasional siren - well it is in Hackney after all!!). The children occupied a room overlooking the petrol station so had a higher noise level but still slept okay. Breakfast was basic - two toast, two eggs and beans. There are only four tables so be prepared to get there early!! All in all, cheap no frills accomodation ideal to use as a base to visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if using local area and want value not ammenities”
Reviews.Author: cyrusrenfrew
Reviews.Content: All the people that wote poorly about this hotel suprised me. I was nearly put off by all the negative reviews. My sister lives really nearby and normally I stay with here but it was her 30th bday party and I wanted to get some sleep fearing a extended party. I found the place to be very basic but perfectly pleasant. There was thin towels and little perks but when something in inexpensive what can you honestly expect, especially in London. I am rating this hotel according to the value it represents. If you need to visit localy then it is a very sound choice for those who wish to be economical. I will definately be using it again in the future. We also got a late and missed breakfast and they kindly made food for us even though the kitchen was supposed to close. The breakfast was very basic but also appreciated, especially as we messed up the times. I would definately recomend this hotel for a basic place to crash if you have business/ socialising in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “i am traumatized after staying here”
Reviews.Author: justmrsaverage
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one night the worst night of my life honestly, my mum and i dropped my daughter at uni and then the nightmare began don t be fooled by the marble staircase, we could put up with sharing a double bed........ but to have to share a cup and a towel we could put up with at a push but once night time comes don t expect to sleep its like a brothel i too had not only a baby screaming but the dad screaming at it to shut up all night i hadnt read previous reviews but i wonder if they live there never mind sleep with one eye open we slept with both our eyes open and the door barricaded i am sorry but we paid Â£79.95 for this room no wonder they make you pay when you step through the door because otherwise no one would we spoke to the manager who never even responded to our views oh and get up for breakfast early not because its so nice but because theres only 4 tables and we had to wait for 40 minutes oh and one good point .... the door on the way out ive never left a review before but please cancel your reservation i wish i had.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the night/base”
Reviews.Author: johnsonn21
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend arrived here quite late to go to a party in nearby Shoreditch. The check in was fine and there were no issues. The room is extremely basic but clean. The bathroom appeared to be clean and tidy. We only used this place as a base for one night only, probably would not be able to spend much time in the hotel/room. Fine for the night if your out and about. Shoreditch itself it up the road and a good night out!! Limited parking!!! Breakfast was slow but lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: DancingKing2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Room was clean as was bathroom. Towels were changed each day. Breakfast OK. Used ear plugs so was not bothered by any noise and slept well. Paid cash to avoid 5% surcharge on card payment. Not the Ritz but you get what you pay for. Staff were very pleasant. Overall good value for money - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not use this hotel if you value your life..................”
Reviews.Author: JimmyKK
Reviews.Content: Checked in paid for my stay in advance (hotel policy). Room filthy, bed smelled shower filthy, soap tray in shower filthy. No soap / shampoo provided. Next door had a baby in the room which cried all night. I could hear it easily through the paper thin walls. Towels so threadbare one ripped in half as I was drying myself. The room above was full of arabic sounding women who shouted and screamed well past 3 am in the morning. Last but not least the fire door leading to my corridor was jammed open - bad you may think but the reason for this is that THE HANDLE WAS MISSING. If that door had closed there was NO means of opening it in the event of a fire. THINK ABOUT IT.................. Best part of my stay was the london fields pub across the road. Very friendly staff, fair prices and outstanding grub.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, free parking, great value”
Reviews.Author: LondonFusspot
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews for this hotel, I didn't really know what to expect... However, it was a great location for a night out in the Hackney/ Dalston area (planty of bus stops along the road). Beds were very clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless too (although the extractor fan was laughably noisy). The walls are thin but earplugs easily solved that problem. Free off-road parking, friendly staff, and much cheaper than neighbouring hotels. If you're looking for luxury stay elsewhere but if you want a no-frills hotel for a night, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: partygirl73
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews I was actually dreading my stay at this hotel! I booked it as I was on a limited budget for a last minute jaunt to London and it was pretty much the only hotel in my price range. We couldn't find how to get there at first and pulled into the garage. As I walked up the road I could see it behind the garage and worked out that you had to turn down the little road to the right of it! You then turn immediately left into a tiny entrance which leads to the front of the hotel. There's no car park as such, you just park on the concrete to the side of the hotel. The location isn't very pretty but the owners try & cheer the outside up with big pots of flowers. The reception area and communal lounge were clean as were the hall and stairs which are marble. The guy on reception was a bit hard to understand and didn't really have a personality but we were checked in with minimal fuss. The corridors to the rooms are clean and the carpet looks fairly new. Our room smelt of cleaning products when we entered which was encouraging! It was indeed clean and to my surprise we had a little air con unit. Everything is very basic. There's no kettle or wardrobes, just a chest of drawers. Like the carpets in the corridor, the one in the room seemed quite new and was clean. The double bed seemed on the small side and was a bit uncomfortable, mainly because the plastic undersheet and pillows made a noise every time you turned over! There was also an awful (rather pointless) head board. It was covered in stains!! The curtains were very odd. There was only one per window which you could not draw as both ends were attached to the curtain pole! The bathroom was fully functional and soap and shampoo was provided. There was a big damp patch on the ceiling but the rest was clean. You can hear the people in rooms around you clearly so don't expect a quiet stay! Overall, as my title suggests, you get what you pay for. It was Â£52 for the room (Â£5 of which was a charge for paying by credit card) I have paid twice that for a worse room in London. Yes, it's not in a great location and yes the rooms are basic but it's perfectly acceptable for a budget night in London. I don't think I could stay for more than a couple of nights though!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell, Still”
Reviews.Author: Haulfri
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m afraid this hotel is as bad as the reviews itâ€™s getting. Thank goodness I only stayed one night, and that was because it was to late to book in to anywhere else. The location of the hotel is not the best, its hidden away and finding the entrance is a bit of an exercise. The lounge, lobby and stairwell is lovely, has lovely marble tiling, but it has no lift, and a lot of stairs, so beware. You need to sign a contract before you have your keys, be careful. There is a nice chap who will carry your bags up for you, which was a big help, as we were up the top. Now down to the gritty part, the rooms are worse than living on the streets, at least on the street you can pick a semi clean floor. The carpet was filthy, and not fit to walk on bear foot. The curtains were stuck together with chewing gum, no wardrobe to hang any clothes, the walls had an unusual pattern on them, I think they call it splattered food and drink. The bathroom was tiny, the sink was dirty with the previous customers hairs still present, the shower had lovely yellow taping holding the shower head on, and the drains omitted a lovely stench of blocked drains. The bathroom being bad enough we thought, then came the bed, apart from the obvious very yellow stained headboard, the bed linen had not been changed from the previous customer. We asked for clean sheets, which the porter insisted on doing, while changing the bed, the mattress underneath was covered in blood, with no mattress cover on. Breakfast was entertaining; this was done by the night porter, as the cook decided that she wasnâ€™t going to come in to work. Apparently she does it quite often. There is no choice, and the food is very little. The only plus point to our horrendous visit to this hotel was the staff were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “quiet suuficient for my needs!!!”
Reviews.Author: jayadams24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel sa i was on a businnes trip from York in the locality of the hotel. I mad the booing through Booking.com at a very reasonable rate of 49 pound.When i checked in the hotel the staff explained to me that, they did not enter the guest rooms without their say so and i was to inform them when i wanted my room cleaned as guests didnt like staff entering their rooms as they had personal possessions. which i thought was quite reasonable when they explained the reason to this. During my week stay my room was cleaned and towels changed as and when i requested. the room was of a reasonable size and clean shower was working and hot water at all times no matter when i used it. which is a plus point as it was very cold outside. overall my stay was pleasnt and i would stay again. a good standard for the price paid

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: John_in_Slovakia
Reviews.Content: I started reading reviews after I had already booked it. I was quite concerned about the location, the staff and the room itself. Fortunately, it wasn't as bad as I was expecting. The hotel is a 15-minute fast walk from the nearest tube station. I walked at night and was not concerned at all (a lot of churches on the street). The neighborhood was fine. The staff was actually friendly and polite; however, I didn't need anything extra from them. They were a little slow at breakfast, but they were trying. The lobby and stairwell is quite nice as others have written, but the rooms need work: The headrest was disgusting, the shower a little dingy, the room small with no wardrobe or closet. However, knowing that you're not paying for a luxious hotel, you can set your expectations accordingly. If you just need a night's stay at a reasonable price (for London), it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Disgusting, vile, hellish hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: holiday8888
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel ever!!!They try to fool you by having a nice lobby, with tiles. They make you sign a contact of stay and then you go to your room to the horror that awaits you. The room- FILTHY, smell of urine, stained headboard, dirty sheets, smelly pillow, filthy carpet, rude and unhelpful staff. I had to sleep with the window open because I could not breathe without wrenching due to the smell of urine. Absolutely horrific!!!! Should be demolished!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in my life”
Reviews.Author: dadone7
Reviews.Content: Since the first moment I saw it I realized that was a nightmare. Better sleeping under a bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor”
Reviews.Author: Ghoffman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the City Inn Express recently but will never stay there again. Looks like the hotel owner has spent a reasonable amount of money to refurbish the property but staff (Nights) brought it all down. We stayed at the first floor and were able to hear loud indian sort of music around 1 o clock in the morning. It was disturbing and annoying for a very long time. In the morning we had to queue for breakfast for more than 15 minutes outside the lobby door because the receptionist who worked the previous night was sleeping on the couch. The breakfast chef was trying to wake him up but he was so disrespectful that he didnt bother. At the end we had to go to the kitchen and request for breakfast. Absolute Disgrace!!!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: worrascam
Reviews.Content: this hotel has no tea making facilities in the rooms, no drinking glass to even get a drink from the tap. Lots of money spent on the reception area and stairwell but the rooms are awful. The staff were very unfriendly and will rip you off as soon as look at you if you pay by credit card, they charged us twice for that facility! our room overlooked a corrigated, disused building and the hotel is situated next to an all-night petrol station (horns blaring etc) BEWARE this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Left after 1st night!”
Reviews.Author: RailFail
Reviews.Content: Very much like the other comments on this place, all looks well when you enter as they have spent a great deal of money on the lobby, lounge, and stairwell, but the accomodation is an entirely different matter. Be warned! They will make you pay upfront and sign a Terms & Conditions form that waives your right to a refund for any nights you do not stay at the hotel. We were booked for 4 nights, signed the form and paid upfront. It's only once you've signed do you get a chance to see what you've paid for. If you don't like the room and they will not change it, then tough, you've paid and your money is theirs. Obviously they've had a number of people come and go earlier than they planned so now they need to secure the income on the room (even though they can sell it to someone else after you checkout early and make double the amount of money!!!) As for the room. It would be okay for a backpacker or someone who prefers not to sleep on a park bench. The TV is a waste of time - I was lucky enough to have a remote, but the batteries were dead. And the picture - awful!!! The shower head holder had been broken for some time so it made showering difficult. The bathroom is SO small that you have to push the door open with your backside if you want to rinse your face in the sink. There was hair all over the carpet and plenty of dust to go with it. The windows were all open in my room obviously trying to air the room out because of the musty smell. You'll also have the added luxury of one dining chair and a chest of drawers - the wardrobe is the bathroom door. The staff try to be helpful but I'm sure they don't really care. All in all you can survive there for a night or two, but I would advise you stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendliest staff in the world”
Reviews.Author: Flaxen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small and dingy, the food was terrible, and the staff just weren't interested in customer service. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: GaryHackney
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is a great hotel and a real find for would be tourists. I was a little bit sceptical what to expect for this money in sunny Hackney!!However, it was clean, with good transport links and friendly staff who were very accomodating with our 2.30am arrival. What more can expect for this price. I booked the budget room for some friends from Poland. There was no wardrobe, which was good because the room was cosy to say the least. However for a place to make camp for a visit to London it is perfect. Clean bathroom which is en-suite. The hotel has a beautiful reception with a large LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: treehavn
Reviews.Content: Not the nicest location off Mare Street, but that's not really the problem with this place. Although the lobby and stairways look quite fancy, it's a total dive. The (small double) room stank of cigarette smoke (in a 'non-smoking' hotel), the bedside drawers had been used as ash-trays, there was a cigarette butt on the floor in the bathroom and someone had thoughtfully left their dirty socks in a dresser drawer. The only clean thing in the room were the sheets and they had holes torn in them. The shower and loo seat were broken. I would guess the room hadn't been cleaned for quite a while. Cheap-ish, but avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Compact but Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your someone looking a cheap "base" hotel in London then this could be the place for you. The room cost the 2 of us about 100 pound for 3 nights, which is good for London really. Yes the room was compact with only a double bed up against the wall, TV stand and chest of drawers with a walkway to the Shower-room but it was modern and it was clean (but could have had a bit more of a hoover) The hotel is situated close to the main road and on top of a petrol station so there are no views but it was surprisingly pretty quiet. The bethnal green tube station (central line) is about a 15 minute walk away up one long street which was OK but isnt to walk if you are going to be with kids, elderly or disabled etc. The staff where polite but could of been a bit friendlier at times, I was surprised when I arrived at 140pm that I was told to wait until 2pm to check in. We didnt eat but the lounge and reception areas where also clean and tidy and presented much better than I expected. Overall if you are in London and have plenty to do and and need a cheap base to sleep and shower then this could be the place for you so you can save the pounds on hotel costs for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: shed_gal
Reviews.Content: This place is really bad, do not stay here. The first room we stayed in was so small one of us had to sit on the bed while the other changed. There was no wardrobe and no where to put our bags it was so small. The heating was never on. We complained and got shifted to a slightly bigger room still with no heating. On the 3rd night (we booked a two week stay) a major crime occurred 3 doors up from us with the police invading the hotel. We were very unhappy aboutt staying there after that but were refused a refund as we payed upfront. They never cleaned the room unless asked and when asked about this policy they said that other people complained about having staff entering their rooms, not a very plausilble excuse. From then on the room was only cleaned when we asked. They changed the sheets once in our 2 week stay and that was only when we asked. The walls are paper thin and you can everything happening in the next rooms. The TV reception was horrible and so much for each room having a DVD player, no good unless you bring your own UK DVD's. This place is the pits no matter how much you pay.

HotelInfo.Name: City Inn Express
HotelInfo.Address: 144-A Mare Street | Hackney, London E8 3SG, England
